abstract: United States Attorney's Office in Jacksonville, Fla, reports Shelton Thomas Bell, accused of plotting to help Al Qaeda and traveling to Middle East to join terrorists, has been sentenced to 20 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A 21-year-old man accused of conspiring to aid Al Qaeda and traveling to the Middle East to join terrorist groups was sentenced Wednesday to 20 years in prison, the United States Attorney’s Office in Jacksonville said.
snippet: A 21-year-old man accused of conspiring to aid Al Qaeda and traveling to the Middle East to join terrorist groups was sentenced Wednesday to 20 years in prison, the United States Attorney’s Office in Jacksonville said.

headline.main: Florida: Man Gets 20-Year Sentence for Trying to Aid Terrorists
headline.print_headline: Florida: Man Gets 20-Year Sentence for Trying to Aid Terrorists
